text: "Remember until I sign out" option doesn't work. Users have to login everytime they restart the browser. Tested in edge and chrome. I am giving one star to bring attention to this issue I'm facing. Please fix as soon as possile.
By far, the most adapted credentials manager for team needs!
The best open source password manager out there. I'm using it for almost 5 years now and it works great, it has everything from securely storing passwords/notes to folders.
I've been using passbolt for a year now. Great product and an amazing security model. Would highly recommend it.
Great password manager, easy to self-host, being open source is a plus.
Easy to install and top-notch security approach
I've been using it since two years, it's an amazing product
Free for only seven days. Should be advertised as paid, so I don't have to waste my time installing and immediately uninstalling it.
can't copy password is a big big fatal misatake. i know its being secure but its kind of useless extension right now, so please consider another extension.

You gotta hand it to Cedric: He cares about Passbolt. He takes issues people have and fixes them in updates. You just have to bring it up to his attention.  The extension itself is very straightforward.  The only change I wish that could happen is to prevent the Chrome's password auto-fill button/icon inside a password field would not share the same space as the Passbolt's extension icon.  The two icons will overlap and one will hide behind the other and cannot be clicked on.  This is probabl... Show more

Recent update broke my chrome browser ability to use Passbolt on internal services.  The logon and password credentials get seemingly passed correctly, but i get a contextual error that "Either 'username' or 'uid' must be specified".  The correct username is clearly autofilled.  And when the password is viewed, the correct password is there.  Why does the service not recognize them.  When I manually enter the SAME credentials as Passbolt enters, the credentials work.  The extension for Edge d... Show more

Since yesterday in the last update  4.5 of this extension it has stopped working correctly. The extension does not work, you have to copy and paste the credentials manually from the passbolt account to be able to work.
It gives an error "Failed to fetch" when I close Chrome and open it again. Passbolt itself is great but the extension is broken.
Every time I close Chrome and reopen it, the extension cannot connect my account. Unfortunately, it is useless right now.
easy to setup, adapt, privacy focussed with self-hosting option. The engineering that went behind it is brilliant and makes me feel secure
Passbolt's definitely worth checking out. It's open source, very customizable, and easy to use. Super convenient for teams.
The most secure password manager.
Open source and secure, really great password manager !

Support is very fast and awesome ! 
For sure, it is the best choice to use Passbolt!
A great open source password manager for teams!
Great until you realized it lacks of TOTP...
The session in the chrome extension is way too short. I don't want to input the master password 4 times a day, that's the main reason I got a password manager in the first place.
The best password manager ever !!!
The only password manager I trust as it uses a tried-and-tested encryption (GPG keyrings) solution that doesn't store any passwords in a way that could be decrypted if the server was compromised.

Passbolt server is great and worked extremely well for a while as one of the best ON PREMISE, fully auditable local password database team web applications.  Unfortunately the newly released (FORCED) browser extension moves all web application files into the compiled extension which is PLAGUED with problems, issues and drawbacks.  Not least of which means your are now 100% at the mercy of the extension developers and the Google Chrome webstore.   Goodbye PASSBOLT.  It was great while it lasted.

Doesn't work after the update. When you try to share your password, the browser freezes. The error appears in the Developer Tools in Chrome: stack: "Entityvalidationerrors: Could not validate entity G...mhafipceonhjepacocaffmoppf/index. min. js:23939:17)", message: "Could not validate entity GroupUser.", name: "EntityValidationError",
Doesn't work after update when trying to get decrypted password
Passbolt has been excellent for our team. Service and responsiveness is also excellent. We've been using it for two years now and are glad we made the migration to it.

For cloud host: 
Very pleased with the ease of use and the security with a nice dark Theme.

Our team is very satisfied of the product once all accounts have been created.Account creation might be a bit tough if you're not tech-oriented or a bit helped.

Pro: secure
Shared passwords between persons
Dark Mode
team is very helpful and quick to reply

Cons: account creation is a bit confusing
password recovery is on your responsibility 

Waiting for: Secure notes
mobile app
possibility to manage... Show more

very good password manager. We use it to store passwords and share them in a group of people.
Support is quick and very helpful if you have a problem.
Totally useless, it does not work at all. Great waste of time. It always pops this error: 'There was an error during authentication. Enable debug mode for more information'
An amazing open source password manager for startups and enterprises. Very secure and user friendly.

This a great password manager! Total lifesaver
Allows me to have strong passwords without having to remember them all. Love it!
I like what passbolt stands for but I've run into issues using on multiple devices. My Chrome extension was auto disabled because it now requires permission to manage downloads -- why?

The Chrome/Chromium version does not work with our passbolt instance. It logs in (as I get a different message when I use the wrong password) thinks about it then returns to the login screen meaning I am unable to use it at all. The Firefox version works fine which leads me to believe the issue is with the chrome extension and not the server.
One of the best self-hosted password manager.
A very nice and useful password manager for my team!
Horrible app. Signing up for "demo" never actually completes.
Very nice and useful password manager
Excellent plugin which actually works with the Passbolt web application, a nice password and security system intended not only for personal but for business in a great Open Source package.
Although a little tricky to install, the support for this product is exceptional. This product shows a lot of promise and I can't wait to see what features they bring out soon.
A very promising password manager. Uses open source tools and makes them easy to use. More functionality expected this year.
best!!!
